post.body:
This is all so neat. The idea of a decentralized internet has got me motivated in web development again. I've never been able to really code but I've ran a few wikis. KiwiWiki looks very nice.

Hello from Indiana!
I had to put some Pink Guy on Zero Music.
ZeroUp is really cool. It's too bad about the file type restrictions. Most of my software is packed up in 7z. :'(
Are there any ZeroMe type communities on here but for people more interested in file sharing?
yo where all the wacky alien conspiracy pdfs at?

I want to start a site dedicated to an obscure TV show but I'm having a hard time figuring out what to clone. I was thinking each episode would have it's own blog-esque post, but I don't think any of the blogging platforms here have video posting capability. Hm.

Just uploaded a classic episode of Deep Web Exploration on KopyKat. Episode 18 from a few years back. I'd link it here, but I don't know how. So instead I'll include a quick highlight of one of the nutty pdf's good ol' Mutahar covers in this episode.

comment.body: Every since I was a teenager I've been fascinated by BitTorrent.
So far Are You Afraid of the Dark is my #1 obscure show candidate.

Thank you so much for the reply! I'm currently waiting on peers to grab your blog. Your description sounded just like what I was looking for. I'm not worried about being completely anonymous as the shows I'd like to archive have never been released on DVD nor are they available to stream online.
@Renalec: Damn you auto-correct. I was supposed to say, "dawwww"
